result.execSummary:
The defendant James B Powell III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:

Concurrent with: Concurrent with any sentence.  Court against huber or electronic monitoring.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James B Powell III

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed, Letter from Department of Corrections.

Defendant James B Powell in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant James B Powell in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case recalled. The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.

AS TO COUNT 1
On motion of the state, the court amended the charge to Possession of THC, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 961.41(3g)(e), a class U Misdemeanor.   Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction to the amended charge.

Court sentenced defendant to serve  90 DAYS in the House of Correction CONCURRENT to any sentence, with credit for 3 days. Court against Huber or Electronic Monitoring.

Court orders defendant to pay all mandatory court cost, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 6/8/2016 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.

Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant James B Powell in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant James B Powell in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defendant in custody due to new arrest. Parties request case passed to further discuss. Court granted request. Case passed.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Court reviewed the report.  Defendant is currently in custody in West Allis, per email from agent.  Possible revocation and sentencing.  Defense request Court impose and stay a warrant.  State has no objection. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.Review hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant James B Powell in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defense has not received a report from DOC and is requesting an adjournment.  Review hearing scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant James B Powell in court with attorney Barbara Due on behalf of attorney Darryl E. Smith.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Court VACATED the warrant. Defense requests another Review Hearing. Court granted. Case adjourned to branch 6.  Review hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith previously in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant James B Powell in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant is testing negative and attending all appointments.  Defendant needs to complete community service.  Review hearing scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant James B Powell in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement.
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, pled GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the case transferred to Judge Brostrom, Branch 6 for a review hearing on 12/16/2014 at 1:30 pm.  Review hearing scheduled for December 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant James B Powell in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel would like to see if a DPA can be approved.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 10/29/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Darryl E Smith in court, defendant James B Powell not in court, in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Dennis Murphy.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 9/3/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Darryl E Smith in court, defendant James B Powell not in court, in custody.  Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel needs time to talk with defendant.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 6/4/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant James B Powell in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Defendant James B Powell in custody.  Nathaniel Adamson for Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Darryl E Smith in court, defendant James B Powell not in court, in custody.  Randy Sitzberger for Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is in custody, not produced from MSDF for today's proceedings.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no drug paraphernalia.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

ADDRESS INFO for James B Powell III
Current: 2030 W Keefe Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53206   (Effective: 04-12-2014)
Prior: 2030 W Keefe Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53210

Defendant James B Powell in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Defendant James B Powell in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FIORENZA, Branch 3.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
